instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02382: What is 820-02382? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.
definitions.CD3218: What is CD3218? This is a common typo,  the person typing CD3218 was most likely referring to a CD3217.
definitions.CHGR_BMON: What is CHGR_BMON? CHGR_BMON goes between the ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 that charges the battery & creates PPBUS_G3H and the SMC(system management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip) and provides current sensing information on battery charging to the SMC. If diagnostics reveal an off reading or failure with the charger current sense, this is a good place to start troubleshooting..
definitions.CHGR_AMON: What is CHGR_AMON? CHGR_AMON provides DC current sense information to the SMC(System management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip). It comes from the battery charging chip that controls the laptop charger, battery charging, and creation of PPBUS_G3H(ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip depending on the logic board part number and model). This is used for sensors. If a DC current sense sensor is reading off in diagnostics, this is a place to start looking. .
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light
threads.message:
My reference: TT9890

History: Customer spilled tomato juice on his computer, lots of damage. I had it powered on and working, was charging at first too. The customer brought this back to me twice. Each time it was not charging. 

After visually inspecting, I saw 2 damaged diodes, I did not have the exact ones, but I used a donor board and I tried using the datasheets to match up as close as possible. The 2 diodes were: DZF600 currently has no voltage, and DZF687 fluctuates around 1.2v. 
Other parts replaced:
<CHIP>U5500</CHIP> twice
<CAPACITOR>C5660</CAPACITOR> 
<CAPACITOR>C5500</CAPACITOR>
<CAPACITOR>C5508</CAPACITOR>
<CAPACITOR>C5505</CAPACITOR>
<TRANSISTOR>Q5216</TRANSISTOR> (Purchased from digikey, consulted with an engineer since an exact match was not found, they said this should work).

All the pads east of CF813 were completley missing, I ran traces/pads to connect them all, RD671 pin 1 has 11.97v along with the traces/pads I replaced.
<CAPACITOR>C5223</CAPACITOR> Is getting 5.1v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S2_CHGR</SIGNAL> is 1.79v
I did have the Magsafe light blinking the other day after having reflowed <CHIP>U5500</CHIP>, but because it was blinking, this is why I ended up replacing <CHIP>U5500</CHIP> twice as I specified above.
I also had to repair the pad West of UF360 <SIGNAL>SPI_UPC1_MISO</SIGNAL> by running a jumper to RF362 pin 2.
I am losing my mind with this board. Your help is greatly appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light
threads.message:
You may have accumulated crap underneath BGA chips.
Or possibly corroded traces.
This looks like time wasting...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light
threads.message:
I waste a lot of time on crap like this. This is an expensive board and all my customers data is on it. Where else should I look at? I just replaced <RESISTOR>R5503</RESISTOR> and the Magsafe light is back to blinking! But intermittently the magsafe light blinks, and sometimes it doesn't. Furthering my research <SIGNAL>PPVBUS_USBC0</SIGNAL> is getting 0v.

I got it narrowed down to <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_AON</SIGNAL> is 0v. Is this coming from <CHIP>U5200</CHIP>? The schematics I have, some of the components do not show up.
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S2</SIGNAL> is getting 1.79v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_AON</SIGNAL> goes from charger (USB-C, or Magsafe 3) to <CHIP>U5200</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 102518, member: 682"]
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_AON</SIGNAL> goes from charger (USB-C, or Magsafe 3) to <CHIP>U5200</CHIP>.
[/QUOTE]
I have replaced the <CHIP>U5200</CHIP>, no change however I wonder if I somehow damaged something from the magsafe connector wobbling. I always stick electrical tape around it so it does not touch anything on the board it should not. The <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT</SIGNAL> I get 0v but <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> @ <TRANSISTOR>Q5155</TRANSISTOR> does get 1.5v. I have another exact same board here where tea was also spilled on this one and its experiencing the same thing. I did have this other board powering on too.
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_P3V8AON</SIGNAL> = 0v
<CHIP>U5700</CHIP>?
<SIGNAL>USBC5_CC1</SIGNAL> is getting 1.65v.
<RESISTOR>R5410</RESISTOR> pin 2 is 4.8v.
Looks like power gets all the way up to <DIODE>D5410</DIODE> pin 2, then pin 1 it gets 0v.
UF800?
UF840 pins 1, 2, and 4 I get 0v.
Getting 0v at <SIGNAL>PPHV_EXT01_AONSW</SIGNAL>
I keep getting around  magsafe controller support and WHAMOLA SUPPORT PAGES?
ov on <SIGNAL>USBC0_3V3LDO_EN</SIGNAL>.
Bad UF400?
FF200/201 is .124v.
I just replaced UF400 and no change.
<TRANSISTOR>Q5216</TRANSISTOR> pin 3 is .845 v, is this supposed to be that low?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light
threads.message:
So USB-C tester stays black, no inication?
Then check diode mode readings on the connectors and around <CHIP>CD3218</CHIP> chips.
Pay atention to CC1/2 pins and input fuses.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light
threads.message:
I replaced the <CHIP>CD3218</CHIP> chip and got the 5v back via magsafe. USB-C ports are all lit up and staying at 5v on both sides. But while doing the diode mode <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S2</SIGNAL> is showing 0.
UF400= CC1 is 1.49v,
But CC2 is 0v
I had replaced <RESISTOR>R5216</RESISTOR> which is supposed to be 255K, with a 270K as this was the closest value without going to less. Would this affect that? 
<TRANSISTOR>Q5216</TRANSISTOR> I had also previously replaced with a part from Digikey which they said should work but I have a <TRANSISTOR>Q5216</TRANSISTOR> coming from Aliexpress which should be the exact part. Would this affect my issue here?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light
threads.message:
CC1/2 pins interchange the voltage, when you flip the cable on the corresponding port.

You should find the short on <SIGNAL>1V8_S2</SIGNAL> rail.
What is exact ohm value?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 102586, member: 682"]
What is exact ohm value?
[/QUOTE]
.9
I tried injecting voltage to <SIGNAL>1V8_S2</SIGNAL> with the infared cam but could not see anything getting hot. It doesnt really seem to be taking any amps. Milliamps but very low.
Now I have no short at all on <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S2</SIGNAL>. Voltage was at .6 when I measured it. Then I went to measure again and I am back to 0v. I got 83.k ohms now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light
threads.message:
You still need to fix <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>...

Check <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL> removing <TRANSISTOR>Q5216</TRANSISTOR>.
If good, resolder it and remove RH006-9 (one by one).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light
threads.message:
This is what I ordered from Digikey, can you tell me if this is the same thing?
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.digikey.com/en/products/detail/diodes-incorporated/DMN5L06TK-7/1964685[/URL]
Now I am not so certain. All this started around the time i tried replacing this part from what I remember but may have been the magsafe touching something.
I may not be testing this right but I get an O/L in diode mode from negative to both <SIGNAL>AUX_DET_SHORT</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CHGR_AUX_DET</SIGNAL>.
I got no continuity at all when testing. Am I testing this one right?

All RH006-9 are receiving 3.4v. The resistors don't appear to be the problem.
I went ahead and replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q5216</TRANSISTOR> again with the same Digikey part from the link above.
Still not working.
<TRANSISTOR>Q5216</TRANSISTOR> pin 1 has 3.42v, pin 3 has 0. I replaced <CHIP>U5200</CHIP> again, and no change.
I have been using for <RESISTOR>R5216</RESISTOR> a 270K resistor instead of the 255K specified in the schematic, will this be the issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light
threads.message:
"Check <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL> removing <TRANSISTOR>Q5216</TRANSISTOR>."
???

The mentioned resistors are 0 ohm value; all of them will get same voltage.
You can't know where it comes from, without removing the resistors.
Each <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chip has a short report output; which should stay at 0V normally.

Any N-channel (low power) MOSFET is good there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light

I did not realize you sent the above message, so in the interim I had removed F5201/00 and noticed <TRANSISTOR>Q5240</TRANSISTOR> was fluctuating different voltages everytime I reflowed it. Especially pin 4. I don't remember the measurements from yesterday as I did not write them down.
Next I will work on removing the resistors one at a time. Before I do that, what exactly should I be looking for or measuring? I will stick back on the two F5201/00 fuses while doing so, and await your response for the above question.

threads.message: So I have been removing those resistors 1 at a time, and sticking them back on. I am not sure what exactly I should be looking for. So far, When I removed RH006, I got 0v, then I stuck it back on, and I get the 3.4v. When I took off RH007, I still got 3.4v regardless of it being on or off. What should I be looking for? You wanted me to take one off at a time then stick the resistor back, then go on to the next one if I understood you correctly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL> should normally have 0V; but you actually get 3V.
Does it drops to 0V removing RH006?
If yes, your problem comes from UF400 channel.
Besure RF402 is good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light
threads.message:
RH006 has 0v on pin 2 then 3.4v on pin 1.
RF402 I get 0v on pin 1 and 3.4v on pin 2.
So I should replace UF400?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light
threads.message: UF400 may be bad, or some problem on its channel makes it to report an error.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light
threads.message:
I just swapped UF400 with a new one. No change. <SIGNAL>PPVBUS_USBC5</SIGNAL> is not getting any power to <CHIP>U5310</CHIP>. Not sure if this matters.
Also, <TRANSISTOR>Q5240</TRANSISTOR> when I was reflowing this, I am getting varying voltages from this. Would this affect my problem?
<CHIP>U5300</CHIP> pins 3 and 4 are 0v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_USBC5</SIGNAL> comes from Magsafe 3 connector.

<TRANSISTOR>Q5240</TRANSISTOR> is controlled by <CHIP>U5200</CHIP>.
Keep F5200/1 reoved, until get correct voltage on <CAPACITOR>C5250</CAPACITOR>.

[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 102750, member: 682"]
Keep F5200/1 reoved, until get correct voltage on <CAPACITOR>C5250</CAPACITOR>.
[/QUOTE]
F5200/1 has been removed, and I replaced <CHIP>U5200</CHIP> yet again. I got 5.1v going in but again <RESISTOR>R5215</RESISTOR> pin 1 gets that 5.1v too, yet pin 2 get 0v. I am certain I am having some kind of a problem from the Magsafe connector having touched something. Where else should I be looking? 
0v on <RESISTOR>R5330</RESISTOR>.
<CAPACITOR>C5277</CAPACITOR> gets 4.4v.
<RESISTOR>R5275</RESISTOR> is getting 4.4v.
<CAPACITOR>C5202</CAPACITOR> gets 5.1v.

threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q5216</TRANSISTOR> still killing <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL> signal.
Remove RH006 and test connecting charger to another port (not UF400).
You should get <CAPACITOR>C5250</CAPACITOR> voltage then.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light
threads.message:
"<RESISTOR>R5265</RESISTOR>, pin 2 I get 11.8v, pin 4 is 1.7v"
These pins MUST have the same voltage.
Also, <CHIP>U5200</CHIP> can't work properly removing <RESISTOR>R5260</RESISTOR>/65.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light

One area I have been looking at is <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT</SIGNAL> which has 0v, It doesnt give me anything either when first pluggin in to power via USB-C.
I do get around 3.0v on <RESISTOR>R5150</RESISTOR> pin 1 but it flucuates up and down.
I am at a loss what to look for next?
<TRANSISTOR>Q5301</TRANSISTOR> pins 4, 3, 2, and 1 have 0v but pin 5 has 5.1v.
<SIGNAL>PPHV_DIV</SIGNAL> Has 0v.
<RESISTOR>R5512</RESISTOR> is 0v
<RESISTOR>R5308</RESISTOR> is 0v.

So you have roblems on <CHIP>U5200</CHIP> area.
Maybe some traces, solders, or components around it.
You may have problems with <TRANSISTOR>Q5230</TRANSISTOR>-33/40.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light
threads.message:
I took up all the capacitors for <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_AON_CHGR_REG</SIGNAL>, and I also cleaned up <TRANSISTOR>Q5240</TRANSISTOR>. Now I have a consistent 5.1v at <CAPACITOR>C5250</CAPACITOR>. 
I however still get nothing @ <RESISTOR>R5330</RESISTOR>. The power is not stepping up. 
<SIGNAL>P3V8AON_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is 0v.
<RESISTOR>R5150</RESISTOR> I get 1.9v.
<SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT</SIGNAL> is 0v.
I did have to remove J5150 because it broke off.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light
threads.message:
5V at <CAPACITOR>C5250</CAPACITOR> can be caused by shorted MOSFETs.
Did you check all above mentioned?

Did you check all above mentioned?
[/QUOTE]
Yes, I am not finding any kind of short. I took the following measurement for voltage.
<RESISTOR>R5700</RESISTOR> no voltage
<CAPACITOR>C5702</CAPACITOR> no voltage
<RESISTOR>R5711</RESISTOR> no voltage
<RESISTOR>R5712</RESISTOR> no voltage
<SIGNAL>P3V8AON_VSENSE</SIGNAL> no voltage
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_P3V8AON</SIGNAL> yes voltage 5.259
Looks like voltage is going in to <CHIP>U5700</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light
threads.message: I hope you've checked for short between MOSFETs pins, not to ground...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-16 stuck at 5v, no magsafe light
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 103128, member: 682"]
I hope you've checked for short between MOSFETs pins, not to ground...
[/QUOTE]
I went back over the mosfets, I was originally having lots of problems with <TRANSISTOR>Q5240</TRANSISTOR> and sure enough you were right, pins 1 and 2 were shorted, I replaced this mosfet. I got the 28v on the magsafe and all is booting up! Thank you very much!
